title: DayanAbbot: {N} 1.2 Spike trains and Firing Rates

cells.data:
- Treat action potentials identically, even though they svary in duration, amplitude and shape
- $t_i$ is the time of the $i_th$ spike.
- Spike sequences can be represented as sum of infinitesimally narrow dirac functions: $\rho(t) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} \delta(t-t_i)$. $\rho$ is neural response function.
